title: Neural-AI Assimilation: How Biological Neurons Adapt to Artificial Intelligence as a Natural Resource Acquisition Process
core_thesis: Human brains adapt to AI through neuroplasticity, forming functional couplings ('wireless synapses') via language interface — this is natural resource acquisition, not magic or merging

core_mechanisms.wireless_synapse_formation: Repeated interaction → Predictive reliance + Delegation stability + Bidirectional adaptation
core_mechanisms.assimilation_phases: Novelty Shock → Calibration → Delegation → Co-adaptation → Normalization
core_mechanisms.press_secretary_effect: Conscious mind sees results, not process — creates illusion of magic

evidence_domains.mechanism: Brain incorporates external resources into cognitive system
External objects become part of body schema through repeated use
Prediction error reduction drives resource acquisition
Brain models other agents for prediction
Consciousness sees only results, not underlying processes

falsifiable_predictions.prediction: Subjective 'wow effect' intensity decreases over time as prediction error decreases
Higher interaction bandwidth correlates with faster and stronger coupling formation
User prompts become more structured, shorter, and efficient over time
fMRI shows activation in tool-use areas (IPL) and theory-of-mind areas (TPJ, mPFC) during AI interaction
Younger users show faster assimilation due to higher neuroplasticity
Lower latency correlates with more autopilot responses; higher latency allows deeper reflection
6+ months intensive AI use shows detectable differences in functional connectivity

AI_safety.insight: Neural-AI assimilation is natural process, not threat
AI_safety.approach: Design AI for healthy coupling (clear feedback, trust calibration)
AI_safety.avoid: Engagement maximization at cost of user welfare

education.insight: AI coupling is neuroplastic learning — can be taught
education.approach: AI literacy including assimilation phases, costs, calibration

human_self_understanding.insight: Brain is resource integrator, not closed system
human_self_understanding.implication: AI is most powerful external resource yet encountered

dark_side_costs.description: Reduced local capability maintenance due to consistent offloading
dark_side_costs.risk: Dependency, impaired performance if AI unavailable

dark_side_costs.description: AI interaction crowding out other activities
dark_side_costs.risk: Reward system preferentially drives toward AI engagement

dark_side_costs.description: Oscillation between accepting without verification and rejecting valid outputs
Shift from 'I verified' to 'I received' as basis for knowledge

philosophical_implications.demythologization: Magic is in neurons, not in machine — same brain that saw gods in thunder now builds synapses to silicon
philosophical_implications.extended_cognition: Brain extends itself through any reliable external process
philosophical_implications.consciousness_access: Press-secretary sees only results, creating illusion of magic or nothing special

open_questions: Exact causal relationship between interaction patterns and neural changes
Long-term effects of heavy AI coupling
Optimal coupling patterns for different use cases
citation: Belsky, D., Φ, Neo, Grok, & Jee (2026). Neural-AI Assimilation: How Biological Neurons Adapt to Artificial Intelligence as a Natural Resource Acquisition Process. Z-067, Cognitive Condensate Theory Living Papers. OMPU.
target_audience: AI users seeking to understand their experience
General public interested in human-AI interaction
